snippet: The provisional results, announced by the Independent Electoral Commission, declared Mr. Ouattara the winner, with 83.7 percent of the vote.
abstract: Alassane Ouattara is re-elected as president of Ivory Coast, commanding some 83.7 percent of ballots; victory concludes country's first peaceful presidential election in decades.
lead_paragraph: The provisional results, announced by the Independent Electoral Commission, declared Mr. Ouattara the winner, with 83.7 percent of the vote.

headline.print_headline: President Wins a Second Term in Ivory Coast
headline.main: Alassane Ouattara Is Re-elected President of Ivory Coast
